results.title: Operation and care of the RCA 400 16mm sound projector
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Explains by use of close-up photography the threading, operation and care of the RCA 400 16 millimetre film and sound projector. Demonstrates the correct procedures for setting up and operating the equipment. Illustrates the packing up, cleaning and lubricating of the projector.
results.title_for_label: Operation and care of the RCA 400 16mm sound projector

results.title: A Hundred-Odd Years From Now
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Australian Dried Fruits Association and Film House Company
results.brief_description: An advertising film with a difference: Into a strange computerised future where women “run things” by controlling huge colourful computers that go bleep booble bob bob ping etc, comes Yockoo, the boy from the bush, with his satchel of dried fruits. Slowly the women overcome their cold, futuristic ways in light of Yockoo’s size, shape and overall manliness. Eventually they unearth their deep feminine sexuality and cook Yockoo a feast of dried fruit dishes using cooking utensils from their local museum. Music by Frank Smith, Photographed by Lars Gundlach, Written and designed by Weatherhead & Stitt.

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Kestrel Film Productions and Hugh Stuckey
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.

results.title: On time
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways, Eric Thompson and Department of the Interior
results.brief_description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.

results.title: On the ball (1st Version)
results.brief_description: A humorous commentary on the game of Australian football. Go there, see it all. The screams, the advice, friendly admonitions. An analysis of the various aspects of Australian Rules Football spectatorship.

results.title: Om and Prom from Cambodia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friends”.
A day in the life of two Cambodian boys. Shows them at school, at play, at home and working in the rice fields. They ride on elephants to the ruins of Angkor where they see the age-old ritual of the beautiful palace dancers.

results.title: Noise destroys
results.creator_credit: Mike Woolveridge, Phillip Mark-Law, John Honey, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1979 film deals with the effects of industrial noise on hearing. Presented as a dramatic short film, the narrative follows the protagonist, Len, as he discovers he is partially deaf due to twenty years of working with loud machines in a factory and goes on a crusade to improve working conditions. The film is directed at employers as well as employees, showing the importance of wearing safety gear and machines being modified or insulated to limit sound production. The film contains light-hearted moments of comedy, as Len goes about convincing his colleagues and management of the significance of the issue.

Produced by the Tasmanian Film Corporation for the Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Cast: Max Cullen, Brian Duhig, Barry Pierce, John Hale, Keith Jarvis, Barrie Muir, Jack Perry, Richard Meredith, Billie Hammerberg, Tony Boden, Kevin Lacey, Don Glover, Tracy Lee, Bob Gunning, Peter Lewis, Matthew Rhodes

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: The Narwhals came
results.brief_description: Shows records of undersea life made by divers in Arctic waters. Includes photography of the Narwhal whale, sought by hunters for its prized ivory tusk.

results.title: The Melting pot
results.brief_description: A day in the life of the Victoria Market, Melbourne. Begins with the derelicts who haunt the area, the early arrival of delivery trucks and shows the hectic crowds of the market in full swing. Closes with the end of the market day with its inevitable clearing away of refuse and the departure of people.
